page.title: 11FARMING IN A NATIONAL PARK
page.content: Because the area is situated within the Brecon Beacons National Park, planning regulations which do not normally affect the erection of argic- ultural buildings are in force. Consequently there are few of the modern large lambing sheds which are to be seen in other sheep-farming areas which make it possible to begin lambing earlier in the spring than if the ewes are out-of-doors. The major problem affecting farming in a national park, which is that of tourist pressure, does not really apply in this area because the number of visitors is comparatively small.
